answers.answer: I wouldn't be concerned about it. My cousin was measuring about two weeks ahead from mid pregnancy. Plus your baby's growth may have hit a spurt early and may slow down a little and fall back on track. Just be prepared to possibly go early.
All my babies have measured around two weeks ahead its fine
You may have gestational diabetes..... that can lead to a larger baby i have it .... nothing to be worries about thougg

I was measuring a couple weeks ahead at my 20 week ultrasound..but yesterday at my 24 week appointment just a couple days difference from due date..who knows really lol changes every appointment seems like

question: I'm 22 almost 23 weeks and I'm mmeasuring 25. I'm 100% positive of my conception date and my last period so I'm just wondering if this is normal
title: measuring ahead?
